He presents with hypoxic respiratory failure and has been diagnosed with a right middle lobe artery pulmonary embolus. The patient also has chronic infections with fungal organisms, including Nocardia and Aspergillus fumigatus. 

The patient's current condition is stable, with oxygenation and HD stable. The plan includes attempting to wean down FiO2 as tolerated and repeating ABG. A repeat CTA chest will be placed to reassess the pulmonary embolus, and if unable to obtain PIV, a power PICC will be placed. An IVC filter is another possible therapeutic option if the patient has a PE. Further abx will be held, and ID consultation will be sought to determine if treating Aspergillus fumigatus and Nocardia would be indicated. Sputum cx for GS and culture and fungal cx will be sent, along with beta glucan and galactomannan. Neurology and neurosurgical consults will be obtained to determine when AC would be feasible. 

The patient recently suffered a right thalamic hemorrhagic CVA. A non-contrast CT head will be ordered to assess the evolution of the bleed if plans for anticoagulation proceed. 

The patient's DNR status was discussed with the family, and they are hesitant to pursue invasive procedures or extreme measures. The patient's code status is DNR.
